post.summary:
tapcli: `assets mint`
MintAsset will attempt to mint the set of assets (async by default to
ensure proper batching) specified in the request. The pending batch is
returned that shows the other pending assets that are part of the next
batch. This call will block until the operation succeeds (asset is staged
in the batch) or fails.

get.summary:
tapcli: `assets mint batches`
ListBatches lists the set of batches submitted to the daemon, including
pending and cancelled batches.

parameters.name: batch_key
parameters.description:
The optional batch key of the batch to list, specified as raw bytes
(gRPC only).

parameters.name: batch_key_str
parameters.description:
The optional batch key of the batch to list, specified as a hex
encoded string (use this for REST).

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.description:
If true, pending asset group information will be shown for the pending
batch.

post.summary:
tapcli: `assets mint cancel`
CancelBatch will attempt to cancel the current pending batch.

tapcli: `assets mint finalize`
FinalizeBatch will attempt to finalize the current pending batch.

tapcli `assets mint fund`
FundBatch will attempt to fund the current pending batch with a genesis
input, or create a new funded batch if no batch exists yet. This RPC is only
needed if a custom witness is needed to finalize the batch. Otherwise,
FinalizeBatch can be called directly.

tapcli `assets mint seal`
SealBatch will attempt to seal the current pending batch by creating and
validating asset group witness for all assets in the batch. If a witness
is not provided, a signature will be derived to serve as the witness. This
RPC is only needed if any assets in the batch have a custom asset group key
that require an external signer. Otherwise, FinalizeBatch can be called
directly.

tapcli: `events mint`
SubscribeMintEvents allows a caller to subscribe to mint events for asset
creation batches.

batch_key.description: The internal public key of the batch.

short_response.description:
If true, then the assets currently in the batch won't be returned in the
response. This is mainly to avoid a lot of data being transmitted and
possibly printed on the command line in the case of a very large batch.

fee_rate.description: The optional fee rate to use for the minting transaction, in sat/kw.

full_tree.description:
An ordered list of TapLeafs, which will be used to construct a
Tapscript tree.

branch.description: A TapBranch that represents a Tapscript tree managed externally.

short_response.description:
If true, then the assets currently in the batch won't be returned in the
response. This is mainly to avoid a lot of data being transmitted and
possibly printed on the command line in the case of a very large batch.

fee_rate.description: The optional fee rate to use for the minting transaction, in sat/kw.

full_tree.description:
An ordered list of TapLeafs, which will be used to construct a
Tapscript tree.

branch.description: A TapBranch that represents a Tapscript tree managed externally.

asset_version.description: The version of asset to mint.

asset_type.description: The type of the asset to be created.

name.description: The name, or "tag" of the asset. This will affect the final asset ID.

asset_meta.description:
A blob that resents metadata related to the asset. This will affect the
final asset ID.

amount.description:
The total amount of units of the new asset that should be created. If the
AssetType is Collectible, then this field cannot be set.

new_grouped_asset.description:
If true, then the asset will be created with a group key, which allows for
future asset issuance.

grouped_asset.description:
If true, then a group key or group anchor can be set to mint this asset into
an existing asset group.

group_key.description: The specific existing group key this asset should be minted with.

group_anchor.description:
The name of the asset in the batch that will anchor a new asset group.
This asset will be minted with the same group key as the anchor asset.

group_internal_key.description:
The optional key that will be used as the internal key for an asset group
created with this asset.

group_tapscript_root.description:
The optional root of a tapscript tree that will be used when constructing a
new asset group key. This enables future issuance authorized with a script
witness.

script_key.description:
The optional script key to use for the new asset. If no script key is given,
a BIP-86 key will be derived from the underlying wallet.

decimal_display.description:
Decimal display dictates the number of decimal places to shift the amount to
the left converting from Taproot Asset integer representation to a
UX-recognizable fractional quantity.

For example, if the decimal_display value is 2 and there's 100 of those
assets, then a wallet would display the amount as "1.00". This field is
intended as information for wallets that display balances and has no impact
on the behavior of the daemon or any other part of the protocol. This value
is encoded in the MetaData field as a JSON field, therefore it is only
compatible with assets that have a JSON MetaData field.

short_response.description:
If true, then the assets currently in the batch won't be returned in the
response. This is mainly to avoid a lot of data being transmitted and
possibly printed on the command line in the case of a very large batch.

pending_batch.description: The pending batch the asset was added to.

batch_state.description:
The last state of the batch that was successfully executed. If error
below is set, then the batch_state is the state that lead to the error
during its execution.

batch.description: The batch that the event is for.

error.description: An optional error, indicating that executing the batch_state failed.

batch_key.description:
A public key serialized in compressed format that can be used to uniquely
identify a pending minting batch. Responses that share the same key will be
batched into the same minting transaction.

batch_txid.description:
The transaction ID of the batch. Only populated if the batch has been
committed.

assets.description: The assets that are part of the batch.

created_at.description: The time the batch was created as a Unix timestamp (in seconds).

height_hint.description: The current height of the block chain at the time of the batch creation.

batch_psbt.description:
The genesis transaction as a PSBT packet. Only populated if the batch has
been committed.

asset_version.description: The version of asset to mint.

asset_type.description: The type of the asset to be created.

name.description: The name, or "tag" of the asset. This will affect the final asset ID.

asset_meta.description:
A blob that resents metadata related to the asset. This will affect the
final asset ID.

amount.description:
The total amount of units of the new asset that should be created. If the
AssetType is Collectible, then this field cannot be set.

new_grouped_asset.description:
If true, then the asset will be created with a new group key, which allows
for future asset issuance.

group_key.description: The specific existing group key this asset should be minted with.

group_anchor.description:
The name of the asset in the batch that will anchor a new asset group.
This asset will be minted with the same group key as the anchor asset.

group_internal_key.description:
The optional key that will be used as the internal key for an asset group
created with this asset.

group_tapscript_root.description:
The optional root of a tapscript tree that will be used when constructing a
new asset group key. This enables future issuance authorized with a script
witness.

script_key.description:
The optional script key to use for the new asset. If no script key is given,
a BIP-86 key will be derived from the underlying wallet.

short_response.description:
If true, then the assets currently in the batch won't be returned in the
response. This is mainly to avoid a lot of data being transmitted and
possibly printed on the command line in the case of a very large batch.

group_witnesses.description: The assetID, witness pairs that authorize asset membership in a group.

short_response.description:
If true, then the assets currently in the batch won't be returned in the
event's batch. This is mainly to avoid a lot of data being transmitted and
possibly printed on the command line in the case of a very large batch.

asset.description: The pending asset with an unsealed asset group.

group_key_request.description: The group key request for the asset.

group_virtual_tx.description: The group virtual transaction for the asset.

batch.description: The minting batch, without any assets.

unsealed_assets.description: The assets that are part of the batch.

data.description:
The raw data of the asset meta data. Based on the type below, this may be
structured data such as a text file or PDF. The size of the data is limited
to 1MiB.

type.description: The type of the asset meta data.

meta_hash.description:
The hash of the meta. This is the hash of the TLV serialization of the meta
itself.

taprpcAssetMetaType.description:
- META_TYPE_OPAQUE: Opaque is used for asset meta blobs that have no true structure and instead
should be interpreted as opaque blobs.
 - META_TYPE_JSON: JSON is used for asset meta blobs that are to be interpreted as valid JSON
strings.

taprpcAssetType.description:
- NORMAL: Indicates that an asset is capable of being split/merged, with each of the
units being fungible, even across a key asset ID boundary (assuming the
key group is the same).
 - COLLECTIBLE: Indicates that an asset is a collectible, meaning that each of the other
items under the same key group are not fully fungible with each other.
Collectibles also cannot be split or merged.

taprpcAssetVersion.description:
- ASSET_VERSION_V0: ASSET_VERSION_V0 is the default asset version. This version will include
the witness vector in the leaf for a tap commitment.
 - ASSET_VERSION_V1: ASSET_VERSION_V1 is the asset version that leaves out the witness vector
from the MS-SMT leaf encoding.

genesis_point.description: The first outpoint of the transaction that created the asset (txid:vout).

meta_hash.description: The hash of the meta data for this genesis asset.

asset_id.description: The asset ID that uniquely identifies the asset.

output_index.description:
The index of the output that carries the unique Taproot Asset commitment in
the genesis transaction.

raw_key.description: The internal key for the asset group before any tweaks have been applied.

anchor_genesis.description:
The genesis of the group anchor asset, which is used to derive the single
tweak for the group key. For a new group key, this will be the genesis of
new_asset.

tapscript_root.description:
The optional root of a tapscript tree that will be used when constructing a
new asset group key. This enables future issuance authorized with a script
witness.

new_asset.description:
The serialized asset which we are requesting group membership for. A
successful request will produce a witness that authorizes this asset to be a
member of this asset group.

transaction.description:
The virtual transaction that represents the genesis state transition of a
grouped asset.

prev_out.description:
The transaction output that represents a grouped asset. The tweaked
group key is set as the PkScript of this output. This is used in combination
with Tx to produce an asset group witness.

genesis_id.description:
The asset ID of the grouped asset in a GroupKeyRequest. This ID is
needed to construct a sign descriptor, as it is the single tweak for the
group internal key.

tweaked_key.description:
The tweaked group key for a specific GroupKeyRequest. This is used to
construct a complete group key after producing an asset group witness.

genesis_id.description:
The asset ID of the pending asset that should be assigned this asset
group witness.

witness.description: The serialized witness stack for the asset group.

raw_key_bytes.description: The raw bytes of the key being identified.

key_loc.description: The key locator that identifies which key to use for signing.

key_family.description: The family of key being identified.

key_index.description: The precise index of the key being identified.

pub_key.description:
The full Taproot output key the asset is locked to. This is either a BIP-86
key if the tap_tweak below is empty, or a key with the tap tweak applied to
it.

key_desc.description: The key descriptor describing the internal key of the above Taproot key.

tap_tweak.description:
The optional Taproot tweak to apply to the above internal key. If this is
empty then a BIP-86 style tweak is applied to the internal key.

left_taphash.description: The TapHash of the left child of the root hash of a Tapscript tree.

right_taphash.description: The TapHash of the right child of the root hash of a Tapscript tree.

script.description: The script of the tap leaf.

all_leaves.description: The complete, ordered list of all tap leaves of the tree.

value.description: The value of the output being spent.

pk_script.description: The script of the output being spent.
